instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins 2 x
threads.message:
Came in with liquid in display connector and 8.19v no light on charger. Reflowed the SMC chip and replaed the display connector, now I get 8.59 and fan spins, stops, spins again and keeps spinning (not 3 x though). I do have CPU clock. Can this be related to <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>/traces, or is that only an issue if no fan spin at all?

EDIT: All SPI Bus Series Termination tested seems OK:rolleyes:, also have USB activity

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins 2 x
threads.message:
USB activity for sure?
Confirm with boot pendrive, not only mouse.
Internal Caps Lock reacts?
Do you get image, only missing backlight?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spins 2 x
threads.message: unfortunately the customer had too flight out tonight so I couldnt finish it, thanks anyway!
